sections.title: How the population has changed in your area - ONS
sections.description: Demographic trends in local authorities within the UK

sections.title: How the population has changed in Bath and North East Somerset
sections.label: Select another area to see how the population has changed

sections.content: In 2020, Bath and North East Somerset was the 10th largest local authority in the South West, with a total population of 196,357. An increase compared with 2019.

sections.title: Largest local authorities in the South West, 2002-2020
Population density in Bath and North East Somerset
sections.content: In 2020, the population density in Bath and North East Somerset was 568 people per square kilometre, which was more than the South West (237), and more than the United Kingdom as a whole (276).

sections.title: Densest local authorities in the South West, 2020
Median age in Bath and North East Somerset
sections.content: In 2020, the median age in Bath and North East Somerset was 38 years, which was younger than the South West (44 years), and younger than the United Kingdom as a whole (41 years).

sections.title: Oldest local authorities in the South West, 2020
Density in Bath and North East Somerset and other local authorities in the South West
